Title: AI/ML engineer
Description:
Company Overview

Deeplight AI is a leading professional services company specializing in enterprise AI solutions across the Middle East. We partner with forward-thinking organizations to design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge artificial intelligence systems that drive digital transformation and business value. As trusted AI advisors to major enterprises and government entities throughout the region, we combine technical excellence with deep regional understanding to deliver solutions that address the unique challenges and opportunities in the Middle Eastern market.

Job Summary

We are seeking a talented and innovative AI/ML Engineer to join our Engineering team at Deeplight AI. In this role, you will design, develop, and implement AI/ML solutions that solve complex business problems for our enterprise clients across the Middle East. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to translate client requirements into scalable, production-ready AI systems while ensuring alignment with regional regulations and cultural considerations. This position offers the opportunity to work on diverse projects spanning multiple industries and AI domains while contributing to the region's ambitious digital transformation initiatives.

Key Responsibilities


Design and develop end-to-end AI/ML solutions from concept to production deployment for enterprise clients in the Middle East
Build and optimize machine learning models using modern frameworks and techniques, with particular focus on NLP, computer vision, and predictive analytics
Collaborate with data engineers to develop robust data pipelines and preprocessing workflows that handle multilingual data (including Arabic)
Work with DevOps teams to deploy models to production environments and integrate with client systems across various cloud platforms
Conduct experiments, analyze results, and iterate on solutions to meet or exceed client requirements and performance expectations
Stay current with latest AI research and technologies, evaluating their potential application to client challenges
Provide technical guidance to clients and team members on AI/ML best practices, regional compliance requirements, and responsible AI principles



Requirements

Required Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or related technical field (Master's degree preferred)
5+ years of professional experience developing and deploying AI/ML solutions in production environments
Strong programming skills in Python, with experience in software engineering best practices
Demonstrated expertise with modern ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX
Experience with large language models (LLMs) and foundation models, including fine-tuning and deployment
Proven track record building and deploying at least one of: NLP, computer vision, recommendation systems, or time-series forecasting solutions
Familiarity with cloud-based ML infrastructure on at least one major platform (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Understanding of data security, privacy considerations, and model monitoring in production


Preferred Qualifications


Master's or PhD in AI, Machine Learning, or related field
Familiarity with Middle Eastern data regulations (e.g., PDPL in Saudi Arabia, UAE data laws)
Experience with domain-specific AI applications in key regional sectors (energy, finance, government, healthcare)
Understanding of digital transformation initiatives in the region (Saudi Vision 2030, UAE AI Strategy)
Previous consulting or professional services experience


Technical Skills


Programming Languages: Python (required), Java or C++ (advantageous)
ML Frameworks: PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face, scikit-learn
MLOps Tools: MLflow, Kubeflow, or similar platforms
Cloud Platforms: Experience with AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, or Google Vertex AI
Data Processing: Experience with data preparation libraries (Pandas, NumPy, dplyr) and big data tools (Spark)
LLM Experience: Working with foundation models, prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and alignment
Containerization & Orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes
Experiment Tracking: Experience with tools for model versioning and experiment management
Version Control: Git and collaborative development workflows
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Berlin, Germany)
Description:
Hey there! 👋

Are you an ambitious Machine Learning Engineer looking for your next challenge? Do you want to leverage your software engineering and data science skills to help innovative scaleups solve real-world problems using advanced machine learning? Furthermore, are you ready to grow your skills — and grow Enjins — at the same time? Then keep reading!

About Us 🚀

At Enjins, we're committed to building AI solutions for meaningful change. We do this for customers in industries where a positive change can be made: Climate tech, Mobility and Online Marketplaces. We have worked with renowned companies like Tier Mobility, JustWatch, Crisp, SnappCar, Groendus, Independer, PlanBlue and many more all over Northern Europe. (Check out our website for examples of our work.)

We are driven by impact — and our vision for Machine Learning reflects that. Too often, powerful models remain trapped on a data scientist's laptop, never seeing the light of day. That's why we've built an approach that turns ML into real business value. It demands engineers who excel in software engineering, data science, and strategic thinking — ensuring our solutions work in practice, not just in theory.

At Enjins, our success hinges upon the quality of our team and the breadth of their ideas. We believe that truly remarkable insights and innovative solutions for our customers emerge from the rich interplay of diverse cultures, knowledge, and experiences among our workforce.

How? 🚀

What? [You'll be doing] 👀

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you'll work within our growing team, comprising 15 other equally amazing Machine Learning Engineers across our two offices in Berlin and Utrecht (NL).

In this role, there is plenty of room for your ideas. Our team is growing fast — and if you're eager to grow too, we're here to give you the space, support, and challenges to make it happen. We're flexible, and as long as you're proactive and take responsibility for your own work, we'll be a great match!

Some of the responsibilities [but not limited to]


You become a full member of our fast-growing ML Engineering team
You'll work in small teams on ML projects for innovative Berlin-based clients in ClimateTech, Mobility, and Online Marketplaces
You'll develop and implement robust ML applications for our clients
You'll apply your data engineering, computer science and machine learning knowledge on projects and you work with the latest technologies such as Kubernetes, Airflow and Kafka
You'll bridge the gap between technical solutions and business needs, ensuring our ML applications create real impact for the people who use them
Together we will keep building our young company Enjins, in which you will play a more and more important role!



Within 1 month you'll:


Finish the Enjins ML Engineering onboarding program, in which you will understand how Enjins work, be trained in our approach and become a certified cloud practitioner in AWS/Azure or GCP
Start your first customer project!



Within 3 months you'll:


Develop and deploy robust ML solutions for your clients, tackling both new development and ironing out old integration problems — all while continuing to sharpen your ML engineering skills
Have had multiple feedback moments with your project team before and after client meetings, to help you to improve your consulting and project management skills



Within 6 months you'll:


You'll identify new tools / methods / processes that work best
Have helped in the interview process for additional ML Engineers to join Enjins' growing team
Have helped your client move along rapidly - their velocity has increased significantly and so have your ML-Engineering skills



Requirements

About you: 💬


You have finished your Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or another (technical) degree that is of relevance
You have at least 12 months of Software Engineering or ML/AI Engineering expertise, gathered during internships or a first (part-time) job
You are ambitious and willing to invest in your personal development path towards a Senior ML Engineer
You are pragmatic and proactive and you like to work in small teams for innovative clients
You've excellent communication skills and enjoy translating complex problems to non-tech people
You are not afraid to connect with our clients on board level (CEO, CTO, CFO, CIO, etc) to achieve maximum results
You are fluent in English and are eligible to work in Berlin



Your tech skills: 🔧


You've extensive software engineering experience in Python, SQL and git. Other languages or frameworks are a big plus
You have experience with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure or GCP) and its data engineering components
You are familiar with software and data engineering concepts like containerization (Kubernetes & Docker), networking, ETL/ELT-tools and understand the basic concepts of MLOps
You have experience with machine learning and know how to create ML models and bring them to production
You've applied the above concepts in one or more relevant jobs or personal projects
You are a passionate engineer who wants to make a positive impact to our world and loves discovering new programming languages, frameworks or cloud services. After all, our world is changing continuously!



Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:


Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and international environment
A dedicated training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching to support your growth
Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes
Work from our office centrally located in Berlin at the buzzing Merantix AI Campus
Receive an Apple MacBook Pro for work
And last but not least, lots of fun! We promise!



Have we spiked your interest? 🌎

Let's have a talk! In the first meeting you talk directly to one of our Lead ML engineers, so ask everything you want to know.
Show more

  • You are fluent in English and are eligible to work in Berlin

  • You have experience with at least one cloud platform (AWS, Azure or GCP) and its data engineering components

  • You have experience with machine learning and know how to create ML models and bring them to production
  • You've applied the above concepts in one or more relevant jobs or personal projects
  • You are a passionate engineer who wants to make a positive impact to our world and loves discovering new programming languages, frameworks or cloud services. After all, our world is changing continuously!


Benefits

What to expect from us: ⚡️

We look for people that want to enjoy the ride of a start-up and benefit from the freedom in the role:

  • Join a dynamic team at the forefront of Data & AI technology
  • Flourish in an empowering, innovative, and international environment
  • A dedicated training program to improve your skills (MLEAP) and 1-on-1 coaching to support your growth
  • Become part of a diverse and driven team enjoying monthly social events such as themed parties, board game nights, sports tournaments, and pub quizzes
  • Work from our office centrally located in Berlin at the buzzing Merantix AI Campus
  • Receive an Apple MacBook Pro for work

Title: Data Scientist (Lisboa)
HTML:
DATA SCIENTIST

Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

YOUR ROLE

We are looking for motivated Data Scientist to join our teams in Lisbon.

In This Role You Will Be Responsible For

  • Lead and contribute to end-to-end data science projects, including problem formulation, data collection, analysis , model development and deployment;
  • Develop advance machine learning models to address complex business problems, utilizing techniques such as deep learning, natural language processing and ensemble methods;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, identify opportunities for data-driven solutions and communicate findings effectively;
  • Drive innovation by researching and implementing state-of-the-art algorithms and techniques to improve predictive performance and model interpretability;
  • Collaborate with data engineers to optimize data pipelines and ensure scalability, reliability and efficiency of data processing workflows;

YOUR PROFILE

  • Master's degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or a related field;
  • Proven experience as a Data Scientist (at least 3 years), machine learning or predictive analytics roles;
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python ou R and experience wih data manipulation and analysis libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy);
  • Strong understanding of machine learning concepts, algorithms and techniques with proven experience in building and deploying production-quality models;
  • Demonstrated experience in working with large-scale datasets and distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Spark);
  • Certifications are a plus;

What You´ll Love About Working Here

  • At Capgemini Portugal we have a flexible and dynamic work environment. Flexibility enables a better work-life balance and gives more flexibility to the employee to manage the working hours, as well if he works at the office or remotely, according with the company’s hybrid work policy;
  • We have local programs that promote people growth, reskill and new skills development (Career Acceleration Programs);
  • We promote an empowering environment with autonomy and peers' relationships among the top scores of our Monthly Employees' feedback;
  • Next to this, we also offer an attractive compensation package and benefits such as Health and Life insurance, as well as Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations and other fringe benefits according with our partnerships in force.
  • Capgemini Portugal is an equal opportunity employer. We promote equality and dignity in all aspects of recruitment and employment, as well as employment offers and promotions made according with competence and ability or performance, respectively.

About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com

Apply now!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Die Mission von Titanom Solutions ist es die Bildung durch KI smarter und zugänglicher zu machen und den Lernprozess so zu gestalten, dass jede in Europa lebende Person mindestens ein "Aha"-Moment mehr erfährt. Mit modernsten Technologien entwickeln wir Softwarelösungen - von KI-gestützten Bildungsmedien bis hin zu intelligenten Plattformen für personalisiertes Lernen.

Als Machine Learning Engineer bei Titanom bist du Teil unseres agilen Entwicklungsteams und arbeitest an der Entwicklung moderner KI-Lösungen, die den Lernprozess von vielen Menschen verändern. Du kombinierst deine Leidenschaft für sauberen Code mit deiner Begeisterung für nutzerzentrierte Produkte, um innovative Anwendungen zu schaffen, die unsere Nutzer*innen begeistern als auch einen echten Mehrwert bieten. Dabei wirkst du in einem dynamischen Umfeld, das kreative Ansätze und technologisches Know-how fordert. Auf folgende Weise schaffst du einen spürbaren Mehrwert:

Aufgaben:


Begleitung von KI-Anwendungen von der Konzeption über die Implementierung bis hin zum Release
Implementierung von Semantic Search und Finetuning von Large Language Models (LLM)
Einrichten von RAG-Anwendungen, Implementierung von Semantic Search und Skalierbaren, effizienten Datenpipelines
Stetige Evaluation und Weiterentwicklung vorhandener KI-Modelle
Qualitätssicherung der Modellergebnisse und neuer Features mittels Unit- und Integrationstest
Research zu neuen Technologien
Teilnahme an Software Engineering, Machine Learning Workshops (wöchentlich), um kontinuierlich zu lernen und den Horizont zu erweitern
Einsatz für die Verbesserung der Developer Experience, um die Produktivität und Zufriedenheit des Teams weiter zu steigern



Requirements


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Machine Learning, Informatik, Künstliche Intelligenz, Mathematik oder einer vergleichbare Qualifikation
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Bereich Machine Learning und KI-Technologie sowie praktische Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung
Gute Kenntnisse in Python und Web-Frameworks (z.B. FastAPI, Flask oder Django)
Effizienter Umgang mit Datenbanken sowie Kenntnisse in PostgreSQL
Erfahrung mit ML-Bibliotheken wie PyTorch und Transformers
Leidenschaft für moderne Technologien, Drive und Spirit sowie Hands-On Mentalität
Fließende Deutsch- (min. C1) und Englischkenntnisse (min. B2)



Benefits


Flexible Arbeitszeiten und 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr? Na klar, Hauptsache die Ergebnisse stimmen!
Mitarbeiter*innen Beteiligungsprogramm: Durch virtuelle Aktien profitierst DU direkt vom Wachstum und TITANOMS zukünftigen Erfolg!
Überstundenvergütung: Jede Minute wird nicht nur anerkannt, sondern auch wertgeschätz!
10% Education Time: Wir unterstützen dich dabei, kontinuierlich zu lernen und zu wachsen!
Eine flache Hierarchie, in der es okay ist, auch dem CEO ein paar klare Worte zu sagen? Absolut
Komplette Freiheit bei Tools und Geräten? Alles außer Windows!
Ein phänomenales und gut erreichbares Büro mit Gym, Sauna, Nintendo, Tischtennis, Kickertisch, Schlaf-/Ruheraum und Dachterrasse? Überzeuge Dich selbst!
Ein Kühlschrank voll mit deinen Lieblingsgetränken? Wir bieten eine umfangreiche Getränke-Flat!
Legendäre Firmenfeiern und spannende Events, die du so schnell nicht vergessen wirst? Darauf kannst du wetten!
Ständig neue Aufstiegschancen in einem Unternehmen, das sich jedes Jahr verdoppelt? Wir wachsen zusammen.
Show more

  • Ein phänomenales und gut erreichbares Büro mit Gym, Sauna, Nintendo, Tischtennis, Kickertisch, Schlaf-/Ruheraum und Dachterrasse? Überzeuge Dich selbst!

  • Ständig neue Aufstiegschancen in einem Unternehmen, das sich jedes Jahr verdoppelt? Wir wachsen zusammen.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Siamo alla ricerca di persone motivate, appassionate ed interessate a far parte di un gruppo dove ognuno potrà contribuire attivamente al raggiungimento degli obiettivi aziendali.

Per la nostra sede di Roma, in particolare per la B.U. Data Analytics, stiamo cercando:

Data Engineer
Data Scientist




La risorsa, inserita in un team di professionisti del settore, si occuperà di attività di analisi e sviluppo di soluzioni applicative in ambito Data Analytics, verrà coinvolta in stimolanti progetti e inserita in un percorso di carriera improntato alla crescita sia professionale che economica.




Sede di lavoro: Roma, Milano e Napoli, con possibilità di smartworking.




Il candidato ideale dovrà essere in grado di svolgere le seguenti attività:

Progettazione e sviluppo soluzioni AI scalabili
Ottimizzione algoritmi e modelli di Machine Learning
Gestione dell'intero ciclo di vita dei progetti AI, dal business discovery al deployment
Implementazione pipeline di dati efficienti
Collaborazione con il team di Data Science per industrializzare i modelli
Metodologie DevOps e MLOps)




Competenze richieste:

Power BI (anche row level security)
Analysis Services
SSRS
SQL
Databricks
Python
PySpark
Apache Spark
Tensorflow
Pytorch
Generative AI
Airflow
Scala
Cloud Functions
BigQuery
Kibana
Elastic Search
AWS
Azure Cloud
GCP




Al candidato chiederemo le seguenti caratteristiche:

ottime capacità relazionali e comunicative
ottima propensione a lavorare per obiettivi ed in tempi molto ristretti
motivazione e determinazione, maturità, autonomia, forte spirito di iniziativa/proattività e dinamismo
Problem determination & problem solving




Completano il profilo del candidato:

laurea in discipline ad indirizzo scientifico o economico
buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata.







Inquadramento e retribuzione indicativi:

Contratto a tempo indeterminato
Retribuzione commisurata alla reale esperienza maturata




Se interessati, inviate il Vostro Curriculum Vitae aggiornato e dettagliato che dovrà contenere autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati secondo l'articolo 13 GDPR679/16 a: livia.prettico@atoninformatica.it.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Chrome
Description:
Minimum qualifications:


Master's degree in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, Economics, Operations Research, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
3 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.


Preferred qualifications:


5 years of work experience using analytics to solve product or business problems, coding (e.g., Python, R, SQL), querying databases or statistical analysis, or a PhD degree.
2 years of work experience in data science or quantitative analytics with focus on statistical modeling, machine learning, and visualization.
Experience, education/training, or demonstrated interest in machine learning
Excellent problem-solving skills and business judgment, articulating product questions, pulling data from datasets (SQL, BigQuery or equivalent technologies).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability of translating analysis results into business recommendations.


About The Job

Chrome is a consumer, developer and enterprise facing product and platform with billions of users. Data insights and metrics are a part of making decisions about Chrome. Your work will have tremendous impact throughout Chrome, as you have an opportunity to work with the many teams that use our systems to gate features and understand users.

As a Data Scientist, you will have a unique opportunity to work across various teams to enhance Chrome's features and our understanding of user needs.

Your work will contribute to evolving Chrome into a more personalized and helpful user agent. You will play a role in integrating Google's technology and adapting Chrome to meet the needs of users in their homes, workplaces, and beyond. In addition to our consumer and enterprise users, we're dedicated to improving and optimizing both the standalone app and web experiences through capabilities and Generative AI.

You will work on an adopted product, influencing product and engineering directions. Your work will directly impact of users by informing feature development and user understanding.

Chrome is dedicated to building a better, more open web. We’re focused on making a better browser (on both desktop and mobile) to help users take advantage of all the web has to offer in a safe and secure way.Chrome is available across all major platforms — iOS, Android, Windows, Mac, Linux and Chrome OS. We also built Chrome as an open source project so the entire web ecosystem could benefit from the latest innovations in speed, simplicity and security.

Responsibilities


Leverage advanced statistical methods on massive, datasets to extract insights from billions of events and thousands of features across organizational sources.
Use custom data infrastructure or existing data models as appropriate, using specialized knowledge. Design and evaluate models to mathematically express and solve defined problems with limited precedent.
Develop and deploy automated solutions, ranging from SQL query automation to real-time Python classification and ML modeling, to address key strategic challenges.
Analyze intricate product and platform usage patterns, translating data-driven insights into actionable product strategy and engineering decisions.
Collaborate with stakeholders in cross-projects and team settings to identify and clarify business or product questions to answer. Provide feedback to translate and refine business questions into tractable analysis, evaluation metrics, or mathematical models.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
For the Central Team of Generali Global Corporate & Commercial (GC&C), we are looking for a Data Science Analyst to join our Insurance Department. Reporting to the Head of Technical Excellence, this position is key to leveraging data insights for comprehensive technical analysis, pricing strategies, and effective portfolio management. With a dynamic, cross-functional approach, the role includes demanding data integration across key domains such as Underwriting, Risk Engineering, and Claims, thereby contributing significantly to the company's strategic objectives. In addition, you will contribute to the development of the sustainability agenda of GC&C, working on carbon emission, green energy, and climate change initiatives.




Main responsibilities:




Portfolio Management

Supporting the analysis of the overall GC&C portfolio results, trends and patterns;
Designing and deploying the portfolio management discipline;
Implementing the portfolio monitoring tools;
Assisting BU in the target setting and supporting BU in achieving targets;
Performing data quality checks at all stages of portfolio management;
Preparation and steering of Portfolio review meetings;
Assisting UW functions in steering the business accordingly.

Innovation

Working collaboratively on pioneering new actuarial tools, integrating Machine Learning algorithms to enhance predictive capabilities;
Actively participate in defining business requirements to evolve the TechEx technology stack, in partnership with Operations;
Facilitate training sessions for the GC&C underwriting community on the TechEx tool suite, promoting skill enhancement and tool.

Sustainability and Net Zero Transition

Driving forward GC&C sustainability initiatives also in collaboration with Group Head Office;
Contributing to the development of a technical framework to embed Net Zero targets into GC&C underwriting strategy.




Requirements

The ideal candidate will meet the following requirements:




Studied Actuarial Science, Mathematics or Statistics or other quantitative disciplines, e.g. Engineering, Physics etc.
Quantitative, analytical mindset, problem solving skills
Insurance business processes knowledge experience is welcome
Ability to build lasting relationships
Strong communication and presentation skills
Familiarity with Python and R is valued
Must be fluent in Italian, English, additional languages are an advantage




Company Profile

Generali is a major player in the global insurance industry – a strategic and highly important sector for the growth, development and welfare of modern societies.

Over almost 200 years, we have built a multinational group that is present in more than 50 countries, with 470 companies and nearly 82,000 employees. Our group aims to become the standard bearer and industry leader in the European retail insurance market, building on our existing base of 50 million retail clients, out of an overall total of 72 million.

Global Corporate & Commercial is the Generali Group unit developing P&C business and insurance services for medium and large companies. The unit acts on a global scale and deploys an integrated approach at Group level with a central management team and specialized teams active in individual countries. Through GC&C, Generali aims to become a key world player in the corporate-commercial segment.




Generali is proud to be an inclusive employer that considers applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, religion, political views, marital status or philosophy of life.

If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation or assistance, we will support you during the selection process.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
A Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil e Tunísia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos


  • Mestrado ou Doutoramento em Engenharia Informática, Matemática ou em áreas semelhantes (Mestrado/Doutoramento em Data Science será valorizado);
  • Experiência mínima de 3 anos em funções como Data Scientist ou em funções similares;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos em Python (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly);
  • Conhecimentos sólidos em SQL Server para extração de dados;
  • Experiência em trabalhar com grandes volumes de dados e plataformas cloud


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://www.facebook.com/affinity.portugal/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ready to find your perfect job fit?

Welcome to HomeBuddy, where making a home awesome is like seeing a vision come to life! We are on a mission to create a friendly and trusted platform to connect homeowners with the right contractors across the US.

What started as a small idea has become a fast-growing home improvement platform focusing on lead quality and long-term partnerships based on trust and mutual success. We are a product-first company with a long-term outlook - our platform consistently and positively evolves based on data insights and the most up-to-date tools.

This job is for you if


You would like to work in a positive atmosphere where teamwork and trust in your colleagues are primary values.
You succeed in an environment that values initiative and sharing feedback and where your suggestions and efforts are recognized and appreciated
You are used to taking responsibility for solving difficult tasks and are directly involved in how your efforts impact the final result



This role is full-time and offers home working flexibility.

Your future tasks will include


Developing and implementing machine learning models to refine lead scoring, identify customer segments, maximize conversions, optimize advertising bids, and prevent churn
Utilize geospatial and socioeconomic data to build predictive models that identify high-value audiences, leaving the competition in our dust
Design and implement pricing & distribution optimization algorithms that maximize lead conversion rates and minimize customer acquisition costs, ensuring we're always in the black
Collaborate seamlessly with marketing, sales, and product teams, translating data-driven insights into actionable campaigns
Present data findings with clarity, conciseness, and a dash of statistical humor, leaving stakeholders nodding in agreement



You're going to need this to be successful in this role


Master's Degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics, Quantitative Methods or a Related Field
5+ years of experience in the data domain with +2 in data science roles
Expertise in SQL, Python, and Machine Learning frameworks (especially supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms)
Proven experience deploying machine learning models to production environments using tools and frameworks like ML Flow & AWS Sagemaker, ensuring our models are always ready for prime time
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail
Impeccable communication and presentation skills, capable of translating data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth without losing the audience in a sea of jargon
A demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team, ensuring we're always scoring the highest in teamwork
Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth, making us a data-driven powerhouse
Fluent English



It's nice if you also have


Up-to-date with the latest data science techniques, whitepapers, and best practices
We value working on Kaggle projects, so if you have a passion for machine learning and are an active Kaggle contributor, please highlight this in your application



Why choose HomeBuddy


Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere without being tied to one place - while ensuring you are available to our team during the agreed working hours
Achieve a harmonious work-life balance with a flexible schedule tailored to your local needs, along with paid vacation, sick leave, and local holidays
Empower yourself with work equipment of your choice partially paid for by HomeBuddy and up-to-date apps and tools to maximize your productivity
Feel valued and appreciated with an industry-leading compensation package
Get recognized and rewarded for both outstanding individual efforts leading to extraordinary results and our team success.
Enhance your well-being with our allowance program covering fitness activities and mental health programs
Learn and expand your knowledge by both working on complex tasks and using paid training opportunities, including courses, events, and conferences



If this sounds like you, we should talk!

Privacy Policy

By sending us your application you agree that Siren Group AG (known as HomeBuddy) will process your personal data to participate in this recruitment process. If you want to know more about how Siren Group AG processes your personal data please click here.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a brilliant new graduate, passionate about Big Data and Machine Learning? Do you think Artificial Intelligence is changing the world with groundbreaking innovation?

Dive into Deep Learning algorithms and cutting-edge techniques to develop human-machine interaction.




Join Reply!




WHO WE ARE

Reply is a company that specialises in Consulting, Systems Integration and Digital Services with a focus on the conception, design and implementation of solutions based on the new communication channels and digital media. Reply partners with key industrial groups in defining and developing business models made possible by the new technological and communication paradigms such as Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Cloud Computing, Digital Communication, the Internet of Things and Mobile and Social Networking.




WHAT WE OFFER

A technological nirvana. At Reply, true innovation runs in our blood. We have a nerdy heart and we are proud of it. Cool tech stack, guaranteed hands-on experience, challenges, hackathons, table footballs and free coffee are already waiting for you.
A continuous learning experience. In Reply, what you know is never enough. Choose from internal webinars, learn from other Replyers and teach others what keeps you awake at night.
A structured career. The perfect path to your achievements. Now with a brand new Graduate Programme.




WE'LL TOTALLY LOVE YOU IF YOU HAVE…

Academic background. With a brilliant Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or technical equivalent.
Teamwork mindset. In Reply, we believe in teamwork. Once here, your team will be your family and will guide you everywhere. We hope you will love it.
Curiosity and drive. We ask you to love what you do. And to always aim for excellence.




WHAT ARE THE NEXT STEPS

The first step of our recruiting process will be a face to face interview with the HR team and then the meetings with the technical referents.




Feel interested?




Reply is committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive work environment by valuing the uniqueness of people regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, nationality or disabilities as protected by Italian Law (L.68/99).

Furthermore, Reply is committed to ensuring a fair and accessible selection process: to help you during the recruitment process, please let us know of any kind of support you may need.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.

Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.

Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.

Be a productive member of the team.




Requirements
A Master’s degree or PhD in Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field.

Minimum 3 years of experience applying advanced optimization techniques to real-world problems in supply chain or retail.

Proven ability to translate complex business challenges into mathematical models, with a focus on practical, data-driven decision support.

Deep understanding of linear programming, integer programming, and constraint satisfaction methodologies.

Strong programming skills in Python, including hands-on experience with optimization libraries such as CPLEX, Gurobi, or OR-Tools.

Proficient in data analysis and manipulation using SQL and Python.

Experience in retail or supply chain operations, with insight into industry-specific optimization use cases.

Familiarity with machine learning techniques, particularly where they intersect with optimization.

Demonstrated experience in developing production-grade optimization systems, including deployment and maintenance.

Knowledge of cloud-based architectures and deployment strategies for optimization and analytics solutions.Expertise in formulating complex operational problems as mathematical models, and applying suitable optimization techniques to solve them effectively and efficiently.

Proven ability to implement optimization algorithms in real-world production environments, delivering robust, scalable, and maintainable code that aligns with business needs.

Deep understanding of retail and supply chain dynamics, enabling the development of optimization solutions that directly contribute to tangible business outcomes.



Benefits
A challenging, innovating environment.

Opportunities for learning where needed.

Show more

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
🚀 Join Us as an AI/ML Engineer – Shape the Future of Finance & Telecom with Intelligence




AI Engineer – Remote First

Day Rate Contract ¦¦ Remote First ¦¦ Ireland

Day Rate: €550




We’re looking for a skilled AI/ML Engineer to join our clients Solutions & Innovation team, where cutting-edge technology meets real-world impact. You’ll design and deliver AI-powered solutions that transform operations for global telecom operators and capital markets leaders.




What You’ll Do – And Why It Matters

Design & Build Smart Models - Develop advanced models for time-series prediction and anomaly detection. Push the boundaries of what's possible in AI while solving high-value, high-impact problems for global clients.
Solve Real Business Challenges - Tackle real-world use cases such as RAN anomaly detection, financial time-series analysis, and network optimisation. See your models come to life in complex, mission-critical environments—making decisions that matter in real time.
Engineer Scalable Data Pipelines - Build robust data ingestion and transformation workflows with GCP tools like BigQuery and Cloud Functions. Work with clean, reliable data at scale—so your models have the best foundation for success.
Deploy AI into Production - Use Vertex AI and Cloud Run to serve models with RESTful APIs for seamless integration. Go beyond experimentation—see your solutions deployed, used, and delivering real value to clients.
Collaborate Across Disciplines - Work closely with solution architects, cloud engineers, and domain experts in workshops and delivery cycles. Learn from specialists, share your expertise, and grow in a high-performance, cross-functional environment.
Monitor & Optimise for Excellence - Define evaluation metrics and implement logging and retraining pipelines. Build resilient, maintainable systems that continue to perform long after go-live.




What You Bring – Your Edge

Advanced Python & ML Skills: Bring models to life using TensorFlow or PyTorch with confidence and clarity.
Time-Series & Anomaly Detection Experience: Understand complex multivariate signals and detect what others miss.
GCP Expertise: Confident in using Vertex AI, BigQuery, Cloud Run, and more to build cloud-native AI solutions.
API & Production Readiness: Comfortable making models accessible, scalable, and production-grade.




Bonus Points – Nice to Have

Experience with telecom KPIs (latency, SINR, jitter) or financial datasets (trade logs, FIX messages)
Familiarity with Graph Neural Networks and Transformer-based models
Knowledge of OSS/BSS systems, RAN telemetry, or trade surveillance
CI/CD skills using Docker and GitHub Actions




What’s in It for You?

Make a measurable impact – your work helps clients make better decisions, faster.
Work with top-tier talent – be part of a collaborative team that values innovation and growth.
Build your portfolio – solve problems that span industries, from high-frequency trading to 5G networks.
Grow in this role – our client supports learning, experimentation, and taking AI to production at scale.




Ready to innovate at the frontier of AI and industry? Apply today and turn ideas into intelligence.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
At Exacaster we impact the lives of over 40 million consumers on a daily basis by working with clients in the Baltics, USA, Central and South America and the Caribbean. Overall, we operate one of the largest big-data environments in the Baltics, and we certainly have one of the most diverse sets of data and pursue some of the most challenging analytical projects.

Exacaster’s team is looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Genesis team.

About the role:

We are seeking a Junior Data Scientist passionate about working with both generative AI and traditional ML solutions to solve business problems. This role involves assisting when designing, developing, and implementing business processes built on top of AI/ML models. These processes may encompass both back-end and front-end development, with a primary focus on Large Language Models (LLMs).

Who should apply:

This role is for a Junior Data Scientist who is passionate about and eager to learn both Generative AI and traditional data science. We encourage you to apply—even if your experience doesn’t perfectly align with our listed requirements. We value passion, curiosity, and a strong motivation to grow in this evolving field.

Your daily tasks will include:


Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to analyse Generative AI project requirements.
Develop data processes and solutions based on Generative AI models.
Develop and maintain knowledge bases using vector embeddings.
Optimise existing Generative AI processes and models for improved performance, scalability, and efficiency.
Create clear and concise documentation — including technical specifications, user guides, and presentations — to communicate complex Gen AI concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Research to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in Generative AI and machine learning in general.



We are looking for a person who has:


Experience in the Data Science field: Knowledge of data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning (ML) techniques.
Interest in developing and implementing processes based on generative AI models, with hands-on experience with Large Language Models (LLMs) such as GPT-4o, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, and similar.
Proficiency in Python, with experience using GenAI and machine learning libraries and frameworks such as LangChain, LangServe, Streamlit, Chainlit, and others.
Knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
Interest in working with vector databases and vector search capabilities, such as Pinecone, Azure AI Search, and vector search extensions in relational databases like Amazon Aurora, Amazon RDS, etc.
Problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively to develop innovative AI solutions.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to a diverse audience.
A proactive mindset, with the ability to work in dynamic environment on several concurrent projects.



Nice to have things:


Demonstrated interest in Research and Development (R&D): A passion for exploring cutting-edge technologies and contributing to innovative projects.
Experience with RESTful APIs.
Familiarity with cloud-based platforms and services, such as AWS, Azure, and/or GCP
Proficiency with Git for version control: Experience in collaborative development using Git, GitHub, or similar platforms.
Innovative mindset: Creative thinker with the ability to develop and implement novel AI solutions.



We promise:


Monthly salary for this position from 2627 Eur gross to 3284 Eur gross for a full time role.
Participation in the company’s stock options program.
Flexible Benefits & Personal learning budget.
10 Growth Days per year - dedicated time for learning and development.
Ownership and dynamics in your role.
Hybrid work environment with preferably at least 1 day per week in the office.
Mindletic – the app for your mental & emotional health.
All the support you need from our experienced team to become an even better professional.
And the most important thing – you will be part of a great international team!
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.


Role Overview:

We are looking a Machine Learning Engineer to integrate one of our biggest clients in the banking sector. The client in question is one of the biggest banks in europe, with activity in over 70 countries around the world, it also counts with over 150 years of existence which means that is an extremely consolidated player in the banking industry (Lisbon- Hybrid).


You will integrate a Data & Digital Hub which integrates other activities linked to Data Management, Data Protection and Digital Innovation. It makes this department a real end to end center of expertise on data, innovation and technology.


What you will do:

  • Collaborate with clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs in terms of complex AI/ML challenges;
  • Investigate and solve business issues using technical, data-driven, AI/ML strategies;
  • Build and/or adapt AI/ML models: Design and develop Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions, i.e., collect labeled data, setup and train models, test and evaluate results;
  • Work closely with clients during application roll-out and all stages of the application lifecycle;
  • Design the most adequate approaches to solve the identified problems within the company’s framework;
  • Implement and assist the deployment and maintenance of models: Follow to best practices in the industry to implement and scale out the developed solutions into production grade software and Assist the operational teams with the deployment, monitoring and maintenance of the developed solutions.


What you are like:

  • At least, 2 years of experience as a Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer or similar;
  • Knowledge of Machine Learning models;
  • Knowledge of NLP and/or computer vision techniques;
  • Knowledge of deep learning architectures and frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, Keras, …);
  • Knowledge of at least one ML development stack (e.g. Scikit-learn, Keras, PyTorch…);
  • Knowledge of ETL methods;
  • Effective Programming skills (e.g. Python) and algorithmic knowledge;
  • Fluency in written and spoken English;


Why join us:

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • … and much more!

  • Knowledge of at least one ML development stack (e.g. Scikit-learn, Keras, PyTorch…);
  • Knowledge of ETL methods;
  • Effective Programming skills (e.g. Python) and algorithmic knowledge;
  • Fluency in written and spoken English;


Why join us:

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • … and much more!

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
DRAXIS is an SME that focuses on developing real life environmental scientific solutions. Looking always ahead, we keep up with and interpret what is happening in day-to-day business, so as to offer custom-made tools, reflecting our commitment to be of service to the environment we live in.

We are currently seeking a highly motivated and experienced AI/ML Engineer to join our team. As a AI/ML Engineer at DRAXIS, you will contribute to cutting-edge AI research and drive the design and implementation of machine learning solutions in the context of R&D projects and product development. You will collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to translate domain-specific challenges into deployable and scalable ML solutions.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with domain experts and developers to design and deploy scalable machine learning models
Work on cutting-edge AI/ML applications in agriculture, remote sensing and environmental domains, as part of both product development and European R&D projects
Develop end-to-end ML pipelines: from designing data collection strategies and preprocessing workflows to model training and deployment
Apply techniques such as time series forecasting, deterministic methods (e.g. neural networks), and generative AI (GenAI) to solve real-world challenges
Translate functional and business requirements into technical solutions, aligning with be practices in ML
Contribute to technical documentation, testing, and dissemination of project outcomes (including possible scientific publications or open-source contributions)



Requirements


Bachelor's/Master's degree in the field of Computer Science and/or Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, neural networks, and statistical methods.
Proficiency in Python, including experience with libraries like Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc
Hands-on experience with ML/DL frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras
At least 2 years of proven professional experience in applying machine learning technologies in one or more of the following areas: Time series analytics, deterministic mathematical functions and stochastic methods
Proficiency in Linux environments and cloud-based ML tools/workflows
Excellent knowledge of English (both written & spoken)
Solid grounding in machine learning fundamentals: supervised and unsupervised learning, model evaluation, and statistical methods



Preferred Qualifications


PhD Degree in a related field (e.g., AI/ML, Applied Mathematics, Data Science)
Experience in leading or contributing to EU-funded R&D projects (e.g., Horizon Europe, Digital Europe)
Open-source contributions or published research in top-tier ML conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ACL, etc.)
Experience working with agronomic, geospatial, or environmental data (or strong interest in applying ML to these domains)
Familiarity with distributed systems and data streaming tools such as Apache Spark and Kafka



Benefits

By joining DRAXIS, you will be able to engage with fellow professionals in your field across diverse markets, fostering valuable connections. This network will provide opportunities to exchange best practices, collaborate on overcoming challenges, and gain invaluable experience and mentoring to propel your career forward. At DRAXIS, we are committed to helping you shape the career you desire, empowering you to chart your own path towards success.

At DRAXIS, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health benefits, as well as professional development and tuition assistance. At the core of our culture is a strong emphasis on prioritizing people. We value the advantages of both flexibility and collaboration, whether they occur in a physical workplace or in a remote setting.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Bitdefender

Bitdefender, one of the market-leading antivirus engines, is used by over 500+ million users worldwide. Our technology has been named Product of the Year by several internationally recognized testing organizations. As part of the Data Science team, you will develop and deploy models by leveraging the best tools and approaches to address business needs. You will experiment with different technologies and propose the best approaches to achieve your goals, working closely with the Data Analysis, Data Engineering, and Data Warehousing teams.




This position requires full-stack expertise in text-based generative AI, from prompt engineering, LLM orchestration and agents to training custom RAG components.




Responsibilities

Engage in the full Data Science lifecycle: data collection and preprocessing, model training, deployment, and monitoring.
Stay updated on innovations, tools, and techniques in large language models (LLMs) to enhance internal Data Science methodologies and make use of the best solutions for projects.
Conduct ad-hoc and in-depth data-driven analysis to deliver clear insights and actionable recommendation.Compare models and collect data through experiment design and A/B testing.
Handle multiple projects independently, ensuring well-documented processes and clear decision records.




Experience requirements

Hands-on experience with large language model (LLM) tools and frameworks for prompt optimization, evaluation platforms, and orchestration (e.g. Haystack, LangChain, LlamaIndex), including RAGs and agentic behavior.
Proficiency in classical machine learning (ML) algorithms as well as deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow) and architectures, particularly transformer-based models.
Strong Python programming skills.
Experience in SQL operations and automating data workflows with specialized orchestration tools (e.g. Airflow).
Strong knowledge of statistics concepts (e.g. distributions, regression, statistical testing).
Willingness and ability to learn new mathematical and/or technical methods.




Education

Bachelor/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or related fields.




Nice to have

Hands-on experience with training and deploying deep learning models in production, including serving live predictions.
Capable of translating intricate technical ideas into intuitive terms, with a clear focus on how and why they work.

Title: Research Scientist (Data & ML)
Description:
Sidea Group unisce marketing e tecnologia per supportare i clienti in ogni fase della loro evoluzione digitale: consulenza, strategia, operatività, analisi dei risultati.

Il nostro scopo è far crescere le aziende, contribuendo a generare un impatto positivo sulla società nel suo complesso.

Il fulcro sono sempre le persone: quelle per cui lavoriamo, e quelle con cui lavoriamo. Crediamo nel potere di conoscenza, inclusione, formazione continua e innovazione.

Sidea Group è marketing and technology. With people, for people.

Sidea Group è partner di:

Salesforce

Zuora

Adobe

AWS

Tableau




Sidea Group ha ricevuto la Certificazione della parità di genere del PNRR, a titolarità del Dipartimento per le pari opportunità della Presidenza del Consiglio dei ministri.





Nel nostro piano di Talent Acquisition, è previsto l’inserimento in organico di una persona che andrà a ricoprire il ruolo di Research Scientist (Data & ML)




Tasks

Adottare i metodi della ricerca per la risoluzione dei problemi di business

Applicare metodi quantitativi per lo studio dei fenomeni di mercato e del comportamento degli stakeholder

Analizzare grandi quantità di dati per identificare pattern e trend

Definire e monitorare indicatori sintetici e modelli a supporto delle strategie di marketing

Comunicare risultati mediante presentazioni, documenti tecnici e paper




Job Profile



Laurea magistrale in Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Ingegneria Informatica, Statistica o discipline affini
Padronanza dei metodi: aver maturato un background consolidato in metodi quantitativi con una conoscenza dei fondamenti di statistica descrittiva, statistica inferenziale, machine learning e deep learning. Possedere buone conoscenze di NLP, modelli di linguaggio (Transformers, BERT, LLMs) e tecniche di text mining
Padronanza degli strumenti: ottima conoscenza di Python e delle principali librerie per l’analisi dei dati, il machine learning e il deep learning (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Mentalità scientifica: essere autonomi nello studio e nella ricerca bibliografica da testi e articoli scientifici. Agire con precisione e cura dei dettagli nelle presentazioni e nella preparazione dei documenti tecnici
Proattività e pensiero divergente: essere proattivi nello sperimentare approcci innovativi avendo la capacità di pensare fuori dagli schemi. Essere desiderosi di estendere la propria conoscenza di metodi e tecnologie per la risoluzione dei problemi di business
Spiccato interesse nell’applicazione e sperimentazione di nuove metodologie per risolvere problemi e comprendere fenomeni complessi
Conoscenza professionale della lingua inglese




Nice to have

Sarà considerato requisito preferenziale aver conseguito il dottorato di ricerca o avere maturato esperienza pregressa nella ricerca in ambito data science, intelligenza artificiale o statistica







Cosa aspettarsi in Sidea Group

Ambiente di lavoro positivo, stimolante, aperto al confronto e volto all'innovazione e al miglioramento costante;

Inserimento in un team giovane e dinamico;

Coinvolgimento su progetti cross-sector;

Possibilità di lavorare con tecnologie all'avanguardia;

Percorso di carriera definito valutando periodicamente desideri e obiettivi di ciascuno;

Piano di welfare e sistema incentivante;

Percorsi di coaching e attività di team building, per lavorare meglio e non sentirsi estranei fra colleghi;

Possibilità di lavorare da remoto con flessibilità nell'organizzazione delle proprie attività;

Per sostenere la concentrazione, in ufficio troverai per te: caffè, snack, frutta fresca e frutta secca





Luogo di Lavoro: Bari, con possibilità di lavoro in modalità smart working.

Join us! job@sideagroup.com

Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03" negli annunci di lavoro. I candidati ambosessi (L.903/77) sono invitati a leggere l'informativa sulla privacy ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 sulla protezione dei dati (GDPR)








Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Scientist

Seniority: 3+ years

Location : Hybrid - Lisbon




Skills Needed?




Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
3+ years of experience in data science, machine learning, or AI.
Proficiency in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch);
Strong understanding of statistics, probability, and data modeling.
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Snowflake, etc.).
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their ML services.
Experience working with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Databricks).
Familiarity with MLOps, version control (Git), and CI/CD for model deployment.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Fluent in english;
The candidate has to be in Portugal and open to a hybrid position.







Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (Banking) | €500-€600 per day | Hybrid - Brussels | 12 Month Contract




Role: Data Scientist (Banking)

Day Rate: €500-€600 per day

Type: Contract

Location: Hybrid - 50% onsite in Brussells




A leading banking client in Belgium are looking for a Data Scientist on a 12-month contract. This is a fantastic opportunity to work on cloud migration projects and enhance validation tools within a dynamic environment to implement improvements for the Foreign Direct Investment validation tool.




Key requirements:

Proven experience in BI-focussed programming
R, Python, Databricks, Power BI, Power Apps, SQL, SAS.
French & English or Dutch & English speaking
Hybrid - 50% onsite in Brussels
Previous experience in Banking (desirable)




If you are interested in the Data Scientist (Banking) position, please apply with an up to date CV as soon as possible.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
All’interno dell’area Strategy, Business Development & Wholebuy Office – Competence Development, con sede a Roma, stiamo cercando un Machine Learning Engineer con la passione per la tecnologia e l’innovazione e la voglia di giocare un ruolo da protagonista nella trasformazione digitale.

Se ami le sfide, lavori con un mindset data-driven e vuoi contribuire allo sviluppo di soluzioni intelligenti su Google Cloud Platform (GCP), potresti essere la persona che fa per noi.

Chi stiamo cercando

Un Machine Learning Engineer con esperienza nella progettazione, sviluppo e gestione di applicazioni di data science in ambienti cloud, capace di coniugare:


competenze di sviluppo software,
gestione dell’infrastruttura cloud,
automazione dei processi di deployment.


Lavorerai a stretto contatto con Data Scientist, Data Analyst e colleghi ITC per creare soluzioni avanzate a supporto dei processi aziendali.

Cosa farai


Industrializzerai soluzioni di Data Science e ML, curando orchestrazione, ambienti, codice e pipeline CI/CDù
Scriverai codice efficiente, riutilizzabile e in linea con le best practice di ML Governanceù
Collaborerai in team cross-funzionali, contribuendo attivamente alla progettazione di architetture cloud evolute
Promuoverai l’adozione di pratiche MLOps per aumentare l'efficienza e l'affidabilità dei nostri progetti
Integrerai modelli predittivi nelle applicazioni cloud, migliorandone performance e scalabilità


Quali sono le competenze chiave


Ottima conoscenza di Python e dei principali framework: Spark (PySpark), Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas
Esperienza con strumenti DevOps: CI/CD, Git, Cloud Build
Familiarità con container e MLOps: Docker, librerie e framework specifici
Capacità di creare e gestire API, strumenti di visualizzazione dati come Looker
Conoscenza ambienti Linux e scripting Bash
Background solido in software engineering
Esperienza pratica con i servizi GCP: BigQuery, Compute Engine, Kubernetes, Vertex AI, ecc.
Formazione tecnico-quantitativa


Cosa offriamo


Contratto a tempo indeterminato
Formazione continua e percorsi di crescita professionale
L’inserimento in un team giovane, dinamico e con forte orientamento all’innovazione
La partecipazione a progetti strategici e stimolanti in un contesto ad alta evoluzione tecnologica


Tale attività verrà svolta con riferimento al processo di integrazione delle competenze funzionali al percorso di trasformazione aziendale in atto.

Pronto a costruire il futuro con noi? Candidati ora e unisciti al nostro team!
Show more
HTML:
All’interno dell’area Strategy, Business Development & Wholebuy Office – Competence Development, con sede a Roma, stiamo cercando un Machine Learning Engineer con la passione per la tecnologia e l’innovazione e la voglia di giocare un ruolo da protagonista nella trasformazione digitale.

Se ami le sfide, lavori con un mindset data-driven e vuoi contribuire allo sviluppo di soluzioni intelligenti su Google Cloud Platform (GCP), potresti essere la persona che fa per noi.

Chi stiamo cercando

Un Machine Learning Engineer con esperienza nella progettazione, sviluppo e gestione di applicazioni di data science in ambienti cloud, capace di coniugare:

  • competenze di sviluppo software,
  • gestione dell’infrastruttura cloud,
  • automazione dei processi di deployment.

Lavorerai a stretto contatto con Data Scientist, Data Analyst e colleghi ITC per creare soluzioni avanzate a supporto dei processi aziendali.

Cosa farai

  • Industrializzerai soluzioni di Data Science e ML, curando orchestrazione, ambienti, codice e pipeline CI/CDù
  • Scriverai codice efficiente, riutilizzabile e in linea con le best practice di ML Governanceù
  • Collaborerai in team cross-funzionali, contribuendo attivamente alla progettazione di architetture cloud evolute
  • Promuoverai l’adozione di pratiche MLOps per aumentare l'efficienza e l'affidabilità dei nostri progetti
  • Integrerai modelli predittivi nelle applicazioni cloud, migliorandone performance e scalabilità

Quali sono le competenze chiave

  • Ottima conoscenza di Python e dei principali framework: Spark (PySpark), Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Pandas
  • Esperienza con strumenti DevOps: CI/CD, Git, Cloud Build
  • Familiarità con container e MLOps: Docker, librerie e framework specifici
  • Capacità di creare e gestire API, strumenti di visualizzazione dati come Looker
  • Conoscenza ambienti Linux e scripting Bash
  • Background solido in software engineering
  • Esperienza pratica con i servizi GCP: BigQuery, Compute Engine, Kubernetes, Vertex AI, ecc.
  • Formazione tecnico-quantitativa

Cosa offriamo

  • Contratto a tempo indeterminato
  • Formazione continua e percorsi di crescita professionale
  • L’inserimento in un team giovane, dinamico e con forte orientamento all’innovazione
  • La partecipazione a progetti strategici e stimolanti in un contesto ad alta evoluzione tecnologica

Tale attività verrà svolta con riferimento al processo di integrazione delle competenze funzionali al percorso di trasformazione aziendale in atto.

Pronto a costruire il futuro con noi? Candidati ora e unisciti al nostro team!

Title: EU Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: EU Data Scientist

Location: Hybrid, Lisbon

Competitive salary and benefits




Join one of Europe's largest B2B used vehicle service




At BCA, we’re altogether, more. More than just your average vehicle remarketing company. More than just any other place to work. We’re Europe's largest vehicle remarketing business, the backbone of the automotive supply chain.




The BCA EU business is now at an exciting turning point in their ambitions for how data can enhance their customer proposition. This role is part of a significant investment in strengthen the Decision Intelligence capability in the EU business, through a continuous development and maintenance of the Data Warehouse, expanding our use of Data Science & Machine learning solutions, developing new dashboards and fostering the adoption of these tools by the business users, promoting efficiencies and generating added value.




As a Data Scientist working for BCA, you’ll be responsible for the development, maintenance and improvement of our machine learning data products in the EU using our best-in-class framework. Furthermore, from starting with simple proofs of concept through to model refinement and deployment you’ll be involved in the development of new data products for the EU business.

The ideal candidate will have experience of statistical learning approaches e.g regression, tree-based approaches, time-series methods, clustering, etc, and will be innovative in model development and naturally curious, willing to try new approaches.




Solutions will be built using BCA’s best of breed Data Science solution (Python, SQL Server, Git, Databricks, MLflow, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Data Lake, Azure DevOps Services and Azure Kubernetes Services).







Role Accountabilities:




Ensure the on-going accuracy of BCA’s valuation models through the development of predictive models and machine learning approaches, experimenting with new ideas to further enhance our BCA Valuation product-set.
Utilise models to provide pricing intelligence to key stakeholders ensuring the direction of the market in each country is understood.
Explain the implications of models and model insights to business stakeholders and external customers in an easy-to-understand way.
Be able to identify and suggest new opportunities where the Data Science Team can add value to the BCA EU business.




Knowledge and Experience:




Experience of using a statistical language to build data products, preferably Python or R.
An added advantage is experience with a well-rounded stack of data science libraries, such as NumPy, Scikit-learn, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, Statsmodels, and XGBoost, to effectively clean, preprocess, transform, model, and visualize datasets.
Experience in object-oriented programming and package building is valued.
Knowledge of a machine learning approaches to model data (supervised/unsupervised analysis). E.g. Logistic regression, general linear models, decision trees, deep learning, cluster analysis, etc.
Exposure to data pipelines for both model training, evaluation and reporting/analytical purposes.
Use of cloud infrastructure to deploy model to a production environment would be beneficial.
Experience of using SQL to extract data from source systems.
Interest in data visualization tools, such as PowerBi, for model performance monitoring is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, including the confidence to present to key stakeholders.
Excellent written & oral communication skills, with an ability to interact with all levels of end users and technical resources.
Strong attention to detail and proactive in identifying and owning issues as they arise.Able to get up to speed quickly in understanding of the business metadata
To question the status quo and suggest possible improvements in the processes (harnessing automation where possible)







Our policy is to employ the best qualified people and provide equal opportunity for the advancement of employees including promotion and training and not to discriminate against any person because of gender, race, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion, belief or disability.







Thank you for your interest in working for us. Unfortunately, due to the volume of responses we cannot reply to every applicant, if you haven't heard from us in two weeks please assume you have not been successful.

Show more
